trans-unit.source: Provides a basic implementation of the <xref href="System.Windows.IDataObject"></xref> interface, which defines a format-independent mechanism for transferring data.
## XAML Text Usage
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.DataObject"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.DataObject"></xref> class that contains the specified data.
An object that represents the data to store in this data object.
data is .
data references a object.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.DataObject"></xref> class that contains the specified data and its associated format; the format is specified by a string.
A string that specifies the format for the data.
For a set of predefined data formats, see the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> class.
An object that represents the data to store in this data object.
data or format is .

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.DataObject"></xref> class that contains the specified data and its associated format; the data format is specified by a <xref:System.Type> object.
A <xref:System.Type> that specifies the format for the data.
For a set of predefined data formats, see the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> class.
The data to store in this data object.
data or format is .
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.DataObject"></xref> class that contains the specified data and its associated format; the format is specified by a string.
This overload includes a <xref uid="langword_csharp_Boolean" name="Boolean" href=""></xref> flag to indicate whether the data may be converted to another format on retrieval.
A string that specifies the format for the data.
For a set of predefined data formats, see the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> class.
The data to store in this data object.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to allow the data to be converted to another format on retrieval; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to prohibit the data from being converted to another format on retrieval.
data or format is .
Adds a <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.Copying> event handler to a specified dependency object.

The <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.Copying> event occurs when a copy operation has finished converting the selected content into all specified data formats, has stored all data formats in the associated data object, and is ready to put the data object on the system Clipboard or to begin a drag operation.
Use this event to inspect or modify a data object after a copy operation completes, and before proceeding with subsequent operations.
The entire copy operation can be canceled by calling <xref:System.Windows.DataObjectEventArgs.CancelCommand%2A>.
The dependency object (a <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>) to which to add the event handler.
A delegate that references the handler method to add.
Adds a <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.Pasting> event handler to a specified dependency object.

Use this event to inspect a data object before the data is pasted, and possibly to decide on an alternate course of action, such as: - **Cancel the Paste** - Cancel the entire paste operation by calling the <xref:System.Windows.DataObjectEventArgs.CancelCommand%2A> method.
- **Select an Alternate Format** - Change the selected paste format by specifying a new value for the <xref:System.Windows.DataObjectPastingEventArgs.FormatToApply%2A> property.
The newly selected format must by supported by the data object to be pasted.
> [!NOTE] > If the paste format is changed, ensure that the paste target supports the newly specified format.
- **Insert a New Format** - If you determine that the paste data object does not support the desired format, update the data object to include a version of the data in the desired format.
Custom data converters are often used as part of this process.

Changing the content of a paste data object (<xref:System.Windows.DataObjectPastingEventArgs.DataObject%2A>) does not change the data stored on the system Clipboard; any such changes will apply only to the data object associated with the associated paste command.
The dependency object (a <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>) to which to add the event handler.
A delegate that references the handler method to add.
Adds a <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.SettingData> event handler to a specified dependency object.
The <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.SettingData> event occurs as part of a copy or drag command, once for each of the data formats to add to the associated data object.
Typically, this event is connected to a content control, such as <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBox>.

A handler for this event can be used to selectively prevent unwanted data formats from being added to the data object, thus eliminating data conversion processing for redundant data formats and improving the overall performance of a copy operation.

To skip a particular data format, call the <xref:System.Windows.DataObjectEventArgs.CancelCommand%2A> method and specify the format to skip in the <xref:System.Windows.DataObjectSettingDataEventArgs.Format%2A> property.
Calling the <xref:System.Windows.DataObjectEventArgs.CancelCommand%2A> method for this event does not cancel the associated copy or drag command.
The dependency object (a <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>) to which to add the event handler.
A delegate that references the handler method to add.
Queries a data object for the presence of data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.WaveAudio"></xref> data format.
This method returns `true` only if the specified data format exists natively in the data object; this method does not check for the presence of auto-convertible data formats.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the data object contains data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.WaveAudio"></xref> data format; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Queries a data object for the presence of data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.FileDrop"></xref> data format.
This method returns `true` only if the specified data format exists natively in the data object; this method does not check for the presence of auto-convertible data formats.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the data object contains data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.FileDrop"></xref> data format; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Queries a data object for the presence of data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.Bitmap"></xref> data format.
This method returns `true` only if the specified data format exists natively in the data object; this method does not check for the presence of auto-convertible data formats.
A bitmap represents a computer graphic as an array of bits in memory, and these bits represent the attributes of the individual pixels in an image.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the data object contains data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.Bitmap"></xref> data format; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Queries a data object for the presence of data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.UnicodeText"></xref> format.
This method returns `true` only if the specified data format exists natively in the data object; this method does not check for the presence of auto-convertible data formats.
The <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.UnicodeText> data format denotes 16-bit character encoded Unicode, also referred to as UTF-16, and USC-2.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the data object contains data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.UnicodeText"></xref> data format; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Queries a data object for the presence of data in a text data format.
This method returns `true` only if the specified data format exists natively in the data object; this method does not check for the presence of auto-convertible data formats.
A member of the <xref href="System.Windows.TextDataFormat"></xref> enumeration that specifies the text data format to query for.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the data object contains data in a text data format; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
format does not specify a valid member of .
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.Copying> attached event.
To be added.
Returns a stream that contains data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.WaveAudio"></xref> data format.
This method returns a stream only if the specified format exists natively in the data object; this method does not return auto-convertible data.

A stream that contains data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.WaveAudio"></xref> format, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the data is unavailable in this format.
Returns data in a format specified by a string.
A string that specifies the format for the data.
For a set of predefined data formats, see the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> class.
An object that contains the data in the specified format, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the data is unavailable in the specified format.
format is .
Returns a data object in a format specified by a <xref:System.Type> object.
A <xref:System.Type> that specifies the format for the data.
For a set of predefined data formats, see the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> class.
A data object with the data in the specified format, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the data is unavailable in the specified format.
format is .
Returns a data object in a specified format, optionally converting the data to the specified format.
A string that specifies the format for the data.
For a set of predefined data formats, see the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> class.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to attempt to automatically convert the data to the specified format; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> for no data format conversion.
A data object with the data in the specified format, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the data is unavailable in the specified format.

If the autoConvert parameter is and the data cannot be converted to the specified format, or if automatic conversion is disabled (by calling with the autoConvert parameter set to ), this method returns .
format is **null**.
Determines whether the data is available in, or can be converted to, a format specified by a string.
Call GetDataPresent to determine whether a format is available in this data object before calling <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.GetData%2A>.
Call <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.GetFormats%2A> to obtain a list of all the formats that are available in this data object.
A string that specifies the format for the data.
For a set of predefined data formats, see the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> class.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the data is in, or can be converted to, the specified format; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
format is .
Determines whether the data is available in, or can be converted to, a format specified by a <xref:System.Type> object.
Call <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> to determine whether a format is available in this data object before calling <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.GetData%2A>.
Call <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.GetFormats%2A> to obtain a list of all the formats that are available in this data object.
A <xref:System.Type> that specifies the data format to check.
F or a set of predefined data formats, see the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> class.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the data is in, or can be converted to, the specified format; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
format is .
Determines whether the data is available in, or can be converted to, a specified format.
A <xref uid="langword_csharp_Boolean" name="Boolean" href=""></xref> flag indicates whether to check if the data can be converted to the specified format if it is not available in that format.
Call <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> to determine whether a format is available in this data object before calling <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.GetData%2A>.
Call <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.GetFormats%2A> to obtain a list of all the formats that are available in this data object.
A string that specifies the data format to check.
For a set of predefined data formats, see the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> class.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to check only for the specified format; <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to also check whether data stored in this data object can be converted to the specified format.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the data is in, or can be converted to, the specified format; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
format is .
Returns a string collection that contains a list of dropped files.

A collection of strings, where each string specifies the name of a file in the list of dropped files, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the data is unavailable in this format.
Returns a list of formats in which the data in this data object is stored, or can be converted to.
For a set of predefined data formats, see the <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats> class.
An array of strings, with each string specifying the name of a format that this data object supports.
Returns a list of formats in which the data in this data object is stored.
A <xref uid="langword_csharp_Boolean" name="Boolean" href=""></xref> flag indicates whether to also include formats that the data can be automatically converted to.
For a set of predefined data formats, see the <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats> class.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to retrieve all formats in which the data in this data object is stored, or can be converted to; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to retrieve only formats in which the data in this data object is stored.
An array of strings, with each string specifying the name of a format supported by this data object.
Returns a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> object that contains data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.Bitmap"></xref> format.

This method returns a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> object either when data is available natively or when data can be auto-converted to the <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Bitmap> data format.
A bitmap represents a computer graphic as an array of bits in memory, and these bits represent the attributes of the individual pixels in an image.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> object that contains data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.Bitmap"></xref> format, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the data is unavailable in this format.
Returns a string that contains the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.UnicodeText"></xref> data in this data object.
The <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.UnicodeText> data format denotes 16-bit character encoded Unicode, also referred to as UTF-16, and USC-2.
A string that contains the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.UnicodeText"></xref> data, or an empty string if no <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.UnicodeText"></xref> data is available.
Returns a string that contains text data of the specified format in this data object.
A member of <xref href="System.Windows.TextDataFormat"></xref> that specifies the specific text data format to retrieve.
A string containing text data in the specified data format, or an empty string if no corresponding text data is available.
format does not specify a valid member of .
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.Pasting> attached event.

Removes a <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.Copying> event handler from a specified dependency object.
The dependency object (a <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>) from which to remove the event handler.
A delegate that references the handler method to remove.
Removes a <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.Pasting> event handler from a specified dependency object.
The dependency object (a <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>) from which to remove the event handler.
A delegate that references the handler method to remove.
Removes a <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.SettingData> event handler from a specified dependency object.
The dependency object (a <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>) from which to remove the event handler.
A delegate that references the handler method to remove.
Stores audio data (<xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.WaveAudio"></xref> data format) in this data object.
The audio data is specified as a byte array.

This method adds data with auto-conversion disabled (the same as calling <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.SetData%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%2CSystem.Boolean%29> with `autoConvert` set to `false`).
A byte array that contains audio data to store in the data object.
audioBytes is .
Stores audio data (<xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.WaveAudio"></xref> data format) in this data object.
The audio data is specified as a stream.

This method adds data with auto-conversion disabled (the same as calling <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.SetData%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%2CSystem.Boolean%29> with `autoConvert` set to `false`).
A stream that contains audio data to store in the data object.
audioStream is .
Stores the specified data in this data object, automatically determining the data format from the source object type.
This method adds data with auto-conversion enabled (the same as calling <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.SetData%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%2CSystem.Boolean%29> with `autoConvert` set to `true`).
An object that represents the data to store in this data object.
data is .
Stores the specified data in this data object, along with one or more specified data formats; the data format is specified by a string.
This method adds data with auto-conversion enabled (the same as calling <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.SetData%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%2CSystem.Boolean%29> with `autoConvert` set to `true`).
A string that specifies the format for the data.
For a set of predefined data formats, see the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> class.
An object that represents the data to store in this data object.
data or format is .
Stores the specified data in this data object, along with one or more specified data formats; the data format is specified by a <xref:System.Type> object.
This method adds data with auto-conversion enabled (the same as calling <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.SetData%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%2CSystem.Boolean%29> with `autoConvert` set to `true`).
A <xref:System.Type> object that specifies the format for the data.
For a set of predefined data formats, see the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> class.
An object that represents the data to store in this data object.
data or format is .
Stores the specified data in this data object, along with one or more specified data formats.
This overload includes a <xref uid="langword_csharp_Boolean" name="Boolean" href=""></xref> flag to indicate whether the data can be converted to another format on retrieval.
A string that specifies the format for the data.
For a set of predefined data formats, see the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> class.
An object that represents the data to store in this data object.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to allow the data to be converted to another format on retrieval; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to prohibit the data from being converted to another format on retrieval.
data or format is .
Stores <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.FileDrop"></xref> data in this data object.
The dropped file list is specified as a string collection.
This method adds data with auto-conversion enabled (the same as calling <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.SetData%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%2CSystem.Boolean%29> with `autoConvert` set to `true`).
A string collection that contains the dropped file list to store in the data object.
fileDropList is .
fileDropList contains zero strings, or the full path to file specified in the list cannot be resolved.
Stores <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.Bitmap"></xref> data in this data object.
The image data is specified as a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref>.
A bitmap represents a computer graphic as an array of bits in memory, and these bits represent the attributes of the individual pixels in an image.
This method adds data with auto-conversion enabled (the same as calling <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.SetData%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%2CSystem.Boolean%29> with `autoConvert` set to `true`).
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> object that contains the image data to store in the data object.
image is .
Stores <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.UnicodeText"></xref> data, specified as a string, in this data object.
This data format denotes 16-bit character encoded Unicode, also referred to as UTF-16, and USC-2.

This method adds data with auto-conversion disabled (the same as calling <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.SetData%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%2CSystem.Boolean%29> with `autoConvert` set to `false`).
A string that contains the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.UnicodeText"></xref> data to store in the data object.
textData is .
Stores text data in this data object.
The format of the text data to store is specified with a member of <xref href="System.Windows.TextDataFormat"></xref>.

This method adds data with auto-conversion disabled (the same as calling <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.SetData%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%2CSystem.Boolean%29> with `autoConvert` set to `false`).
A string that contains the text data to store in the data object.
A member of <xref href="System.Windows.TextDataFormat"></xref> that specifies the text data format to store.
textData is .
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.SettingData> attached event.
To be added.
Creates a connection between a data object and an advisory sink.
This method is called by an object that supports an advisory sink and enables the advisory sink to be notified of changes in the object's data.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject> interface.
A <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.FORMATETC> structure, passed by reference, that defines the format, target device, aspect, and medium that will be used for future notifications.
One of the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.ADVF> values that specifies a group of flags for controlling the advisory connection.
A pointer to the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IAdviseSink> interface on the advisory sink that will receive the change notification.
When this method returns, contains a pointer to a DWORD token that identifies this connection.
You can use this token later to delete the advisory connection by passing it to <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject.DUnadvise*>.
If this value is zero, the connection was not established.
This parameter is passed uninitialized.
This method supports the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, as well as the following:
Destroys a notification connection that had been previously established.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject> interface.
A DWORD token that specifies the connection to remove.
Use the value returned by <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject.DAdvise*> when the connection was originally established.
Creates an object that can be used to enumerate the current advisory connections.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject> interface.
When this method returns, contains an <xref href="System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IEnumSTATDATA"></xref> that receives the interface pointer to the new enumerator object.
If the implementation sets `enumAdvise` to <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, there are no connections to advisory sinks at this time.
This parameter is passed uninitialized.
This method supports the standard return value E_OUTOFMEMORY, as well as the following:
Value
Description
S_OK
The enumerator object is successfully instantiated or there are no connections.
OLE_E_ADVISENOTSUPPORTED
This object does not support advisory notifications.
Creates an object for enumerating the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.FORMATETC> structures for a data object.
These structures are used in calls to <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject.GetData*> or <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject.SetData*>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject> interface.
One of the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.DATADIR> values that specifies the direction of the data.
This method supports the standard return values E_INVALIDARG and E_OUTOFMEMORY, as well as the following:
Value
Description
S_OK
The enumerator object was successfully created.
E_NOTIMPL
The direction specified by the direction parameter is not supported.
OLE_S_USEREG
Requests that OLE enumerate the formats from the registry.
Provides a standard <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.FORMATETC> structure that is logically equivalent to a more complex structure.
Use this method to determine whether two different <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.FORMATETC> structures would return the same data, removing the need for duplicate rendering.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject> interface.

A pointer to a <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.FORMATETC> structure, passed by reference, that defines the format, medium, and target device that the caller would like to use to retrieve data in a subsequent call such as <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject.GetData*>.
The <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYMED> member is not significant in this case and should be ignored.

When this method returns, contains a pointer to a <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.FORMATETC> structure that contains the most general information possible for a specific rendering, making it canonically equivalent to `formatetIn`.

The caller must allocate this structure and the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject.GetCanonicalFormatEtc*> method must fill in the data. To retrieve data in a subsequent call such as <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject.GetData*>, the caller uses the supplied value of `formatOut`, unless the value supplied is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
This value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the method returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_DATA_S_SAMEFORMATETC" name="DATA_S_SAMEFORMATETC" href=""></xref>.
The <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYMED> member is not significant in this case and should be ignored.
This parameter is passed uninitialized.
This method supports the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, as well as the following:
Value
Description
S_OK
The returned <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.FORMATETC> structure is different from the one that was passed.
DATA_S_SAMEFORMATETC
The structures are the same and is returned in the formatOut parameter.
DV_E_LINDEX
There is an invalid value for <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.FORMATETC.lindex>; currently, only -1 is supported.
DV_E_FORMATETC
There is an invalid value for the pFormatetc parameter.
OLE_E_NOTRUNNING
The application is not running.
Obtains data from a source data object.

The <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject.GetData*> method, which is called by a data consumer, renders the data described in the specified <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.FORMATETC> structure and transfers it through the specified <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.STGMEDIUM> structure.
The caller then assumes responsibility for releasing the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.STGMEDIUM> structure.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject> interface.
A pointer to a <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.FORMATETC> structure, passed by reference, that defines the format, medium, and target device to use when passing the data.
It is possible to specify more than one medium by using the Boolean OR operator, allowing the method to choose the best medium among those specified.

When this method returns, contains a pointer to the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.STGMEDIUM> structure that indicates the storage medium containing the returned data through its <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.STGMEDIUM> member, and the responsibility for releasing the medium through the value of its <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.STGMEDIUM> member.

If <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.STGMEDIUM> is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, the receiver of the medium is responsible for releasing it; otherwise, <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.STGMEDIUM> points to the <xref uid="langword_csharp_IUnknown" name="IUnknown" href=""></xref> interface on the appropriate object so its <xref uid="langword_csharp_Release" name="Release" href=""></xref> method can be called.
The medium must be allocated and filled in by <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject.GetData*>.
This parameter is passed uninitialized.
Obtains data from a source data object.

This method, which is called by a data consumer, differs from the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject.GetData*> method in that the caller must allocate and free the specified storage medium.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject> interface.
A pointer to a <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.FORMATETC> structure, passed by reference, that defines the format, medium, and target device to use when passing the data.

Only one medium can be specified in <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYMED>, and only the following <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYMED> values are valid: <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYMED>, <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYMED>, <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYMED>, or <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYMED>.
A <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.STGMEDIUM>, passed by reference, that defines the storage medium containing the data being transferred.
The medium must be allocated by the caller and filled in by <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject.GetDataHere*>.
The caller must also free the medium.

The implementation of this method must always supply a value of <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> for the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.STGMEDIUM.pUnkForRelease> member of the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.STGMEDIUM> structure that this parameter points to.
Determines whether the data object is capable of rendering the data described in the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.FORMATETC> structure.

Objects attempting a paste or drop operation can call this method before calling <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject.GetData*> to get an indication of whether the operation may be successful.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject> interface.
A pointer to a <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.FORMATETC> structure, passed by reference, that defines the format, medium, and target device to use for the query.
This method supports the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, as well as the following:
Value
Description
S_OK
A subsequent call to <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject.GetData*> would probably be successful.
DV_E_LINDEX
An invalid value for <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.FORMATETC.lindex>; currently, only -1 is supported.
DV_E_FORMATETC
An invalid value for the pFormatetc parameter.
DV_E_TYMED
An invalid <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.FORMATETC.tymed> value.
DV_E_DVASPECT
An invalid <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.FORMATETC.dwAspect> value.
OLE_E_NOTRUNNING
The application is not running.
Transfers data to the object that implements this method.
This method is called by an object that contains a data source.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject> interface.
A <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.FORMATETC> structure, passed by reference, that defines the format used by the data object when interpreting the data contained in the storage medium.
A <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.STGMEDIUM> structure, passed by reference, that defines the storage medium in which the data is being passed.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to specify that the data object called, which implements <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject.SetData*>, owns the storage medium after the call returns.
This means that the data object must free the medium after it has been used by calling the <xref uid="langword_csharp_ReleaseStgMedium" name="ReleaseStgMedium" href=""></xref> function.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to specify that the caller retains ownership of the storage medium, and the data object called uses the storage medium for the duration of the call only.
